definitions: arranged in horizontal layers or levels stacked one above another
structured with different ranks, grades, or categories in hierarchical order
examples: The tiered wedding cake stood five layers tall
She wore a beautiful tiered skirt to the party
The company uses a tiered pricing system for customers
Their tiered membership program offers increasing benefits

definitions: covered or decorated with ceramic, stone, or similar flat pieces
arranged in a regular pattern resembling tile placement
examples: The tiled bathroom floor gleamed after cleaning
They admired the beautifully tiled kitchen backsplash
The tiled windows displayed multiple applications simultaneously
She created a tiled pattern with the photographs

definitions: prepared and cultivated by breaking up soil for agricultural purposes
having been worked or cultivated as farmland in the past
examples: The freshly tilled soil was ready for planting
Farmers surveyed their tilled fields before sowing
The tilled land showed evidence of ancient farming
These tilled acres have produced crops for generations

definitions: positioned at an angle rather than upright or level
showing bias or favoritism toward a particular side or viewpoint
examples: The tilted picture frame needed straightening on the wall
She wore her hat at a tilted angle
The tilted coverage favored one political party
The competition seemed tilted against smaller companies

definitions: constructed with or featuring exposed wooden beams or framework
covered with trees suitable for timber; having forest growth
examples: The timbered cottage had beautiful exposed ceiling beams
They stayed in a traditional timbered inn
The timbered hillsides provided lumber for construction
These timbered lands have been protected for decades

definitions: scheduled or coordinated to occur at a specific moment
having a measured or recorded duration of time
examples: The perfectly timed entrance surprised everyone at the party
Their timed release of information was strategic
Students completed the timed exam in ninety minutes
The timed race determined the fastest runner

definitions: remaining beautiful, relevant, or admired regardless of changing fashions or time
existing or appearing to exist outside the normal flow of time
examples: Her timeless elegance never goes out of style
Shakespeare's plays contain timeless themes about humanity
The painting captured a timeless moment of serenity
They entered a timeless realm in their dreams

definitions: occurring at a favorable, suitable, or useful time
done or occurring at the expected or proper time
examples: Your timely intervention prevented a serious accident
The timely rain saved the drought-stricken crops
Please ensure timely submission of your reports
Their timely arrival allowed the meeting to start

definitions: showing lack of courage or confidence; hesitant and nervous
easily alarmed or made afraid; showing fear readily
examples: The timid student rarely spoke up in class
His timid approach to dating limited his opportunities
The timid rabbit fled at the slightest noise
Her timid nature made her avoid confrontations

definitions: causing or characterized by a slight stinging or prickling sensation
causing excitement, anticipation, or a thrilling feeling
examples: The tingling sensation in her fingers indicated poor circulation
He felt a tingling numbness after sitting too long
The tingling excitement before the concert was palpable
She experienced a tingling sense of anticipation

definitions: preserved and sealed in metal cans for long-term storage
covered or plated with a thin layer of tin metal
examples: They stocked tinned foods for the camping trip
The tinned tomatoes worked perfectly in the sauce
The tinned copper cookware gleamed on the shelf
These tinned steel containers resist corrosion well

definitions: very small in size, amount, or degree; minute or miniature
examples: The tiny kitten fit in the palm of her hand
They lived in a tiny apartment downtown
She noticed tiny details others might miss
The tiny difference in temperature was barely perceptible

definitions: having an end or point covered or decorated with something
tilted, inclined, or turned over from an upright position
examples: The silver-tipped cane belonged to her grandfather
She used gold-tipped markers for her artwork
The tipped chair lay on its side
Several tipped garbage cans littered the alley

definitions: slightly intoxicated by alcohol but not completely drunk
examples: After two glasses of wine, she felt pleasantly tipsy
The tipsy guests laughed at everything
His tipsy walk showed he'd had too much
She became tipsy at the office party

definitions: in need of sleep or rest; exhausted or weary
bored with or no longer interested in something
examples: The tired children fell asleep immediately after dinner
She felt tired after working all day
He's tired of hearing the same excuses repeatedly
The audience grew tired of the lengthy speech

definitions: having or showing great effort or energy without becoming tired
examples: Her tireless efforts finally paid off with success
The tireless volunteer worked throughout the night
He was a tireless advocate for social justice
Their tireless campaigning changed public opinion

definitions: causing one to feel bored, annoyed, or impatient through being tedious
examples: The tiresome journey took twelve hours by bus
His tiresome complaints annoyed everyone
She found the repetitive work increasingly tiresome
The tiresome procedures delayed the project considerably

definitions: causing one to need rest through physical or mental exertion
examples: The tiring hike up the mountain exhausted everyone
She found the constant travel tiring
Teaching young children can be mentally tiring
The tiring work schedule affected his health

definitions: of exceptional strength, size, or power; colossal or gigantic
requiring or involving enormous effort, strength, or resources
examples: The titanic waves crashed against the cliffs
They faced a titanic mountain of debt
It took titanic effort to move the boulder
The titanic struggle lasted for years

definitions: having a name or designation, especially for a work or position
having a hereditary or honorary title of nobility
examples: The newly titled book became a bestseller
Each titled chapter began with a quote
The titled aristocrat owned several estates
She married into a titled family

definitions: relating to or constituting a title of a work or position
holding a title but without real power or authority
examples: The titular character appears in every scene
She played the titular role in Hamlet
He served as titular head while others governed
The king remained a titular monarch only

definitions: browned, crisped, or dried by exposure to heat
having been honored or celebrated with a ceremonial drink
examples: She buttered the toasted bread for breakfast
The toasted marshmallows were perfectly golden
The toasted couple smiled at their wedding guests
The recently toasted champion gave a speech

definitions: having toes of a specified kind, number, or arrangement
examples: The three-toed sloth moved slowly through trees
She wore open-toed sandals to the beach
The steel-toed boots protected his feet
These square-toed shoes are very fashionable

definitions: done for the sake of appearance or as a symbolic gesture only
examples: They made a token effort to help
The company hired a token number of minorities
His token resistance quickly crumbled under pressure
She offered token opposition to the proposal

definitions: able to be endured or accepted without serious complaint
moderately good or satisfactory but not excellent
examples: The pain was barely tolerable without medication
Working conditions became more tolerable after improvements
The food was tolerable but nothing special
She spoke tolerable French after studying abroad

definitions: showing willingness to allow beliefs or behavior different from one's own
able to endure or resist harmful conditions without adverse reaction
examples: The tolerant teacher encouraged diverse viewpoints in class
Our tolerant society welcomes people from all backgrounds
These drought-tolerant plants survive with minimal water
She's remarkably tolerant of cold weather

definitions: relating to the tone or tones of music, color, or sound
using variations in pitch to distinguish word meaning in language
examples: The tonal qualities of the violin were exceptional
She studied tonal harmony in music school
Mandarin is a tonal language with four tones
The tonal system affects meaning in Vietnamese

definitions: having firm, well-defined muscles from exercise
having a particular quality, color, or shade of tone
examples: Her toned arms showed hours of gym work
The athlete's toned physique impressed everyone
The sepia-toned photograph looked antique
His carefully toned response avoided controversy

definitions: having a tongue of a specified kind or speaking in a specified manner
examples: The sharp-tongued critic wrote harsh reviews
Her silver-tongued speech convinced the jury
The long-tongued lizard caught insects easily
These tongued joints fit together perfectly

definitions: giving a feeling of vigor, energy, or well-being
relating to or denoting the first note of a musical scale
examples: The tonic effect of mountain air revived them
A tonic swim in cold water woke him up
The tonic chord provides resolution in the progression
She played the tonic note to establish the key

definitions: having teeth of a specified type or number
having tooth-like projections or serrated edges
examples: The saw-toothed shark swam past the divers
A gap-toothed smile lit up his face
The toothed gear meshed perfectly with its partner
She used a toothed blade to cut bread

definitions: having no teeth, especially through old age or loss
lacking the power or ability to be effective
examples: The toothless old man gummed his food
Her toothless grin was endearing
The toothless regulations failed to prevent violations
Critics called the new law toothless

definitions: situated at the highest physical point or position
of the highest quality, degree, or importance
examples: The top shelf held the special dishes
She lived on the top floor of the building
He graduated with top honors from university
This is our top priority this quarter

definitions: relating to current events or matters of immediate interest
designed for application to a particular part of the body
examples: The comedian's topical jokes referenced recent news
Her topical commentary addressed current political issues
The doctor prescribed a topical cream for the rash
This topical anesthetic numbs only the treated area

definitions: not wearing clothing on the upper part of the body
having no upper covering, roof, or maximum limit
examples: The topless sunbathers relaxed on the beach
Some European beaches allow topless swimming
They drove the topless convertible along the coast
The topless tower seemed to reach the sky

definitions: situated at the very top or highest point of something
examples: The topmost branches swayed in the wind
She placed the star on the topmost point
The topmost priority requires immediate attention
He reached the topmost level of management

definitions: relating to the arrangement of physical features of an area
examples: The topographic map showed elevation changes clearly
They studied topographic features of the region
His topographic survey revealed hidden valleys
The topographic data helped plan the route

definitions: relating to the detailed description or representation of surface features
examples: The topographical analysis revealed ancient settlements
She created detailed topographical drawings
Their topographical knowledge helped navigate the terrain
The topographical variations affected local climate

definitions: covered or decorated with something on top
exceeded in amount, quality, or achievement
examples: The chocolate-topped cake looked delicious
Snow-topped mountains surrounded the valley
Sales topped last year's record by twenty percent
Her performance topped all expectations

definitions: British informal: excellent, first-rate, or extremely good
examples: That was absolutely topping entertainment last night
She gave a topping performance in the play
The weather was topping for our picnic
He thought the idea was simply topping

definitions: informal: of the highest quality or excellence
examples: The service at this restaurant is absolutely tops
She's tops in her field of research
That performance was tops among all contestants
This brand is tops for reliability

definitions: experiencing severe mental or emotional suffering and distress
having been subjected to severe physical or mental suffering
examples: The tormented artist expressed pain through his work
Her tormented expression revealed inner turmoil
The tormented prisoners finally gained their freedom
His tormented soul sought peace

definitions: damaged by being pulled apart or having a hole made
feeling conflicted between different choices or emotions
examples: Her torn dress needed immediate mending
The torn pages made the book difficult to read
He felt torn between career and family
She was torn about accepting the offer

definitions: falling rapidly and in copious quantities, especially of rain
examples: Torrential rain flooded the streets within hours
The torrential downpour canceled outdoor events
Torrential waters rushed through the canyon
They endured torrential storms during monsoon season

definitions: very hot and dry, especially of weather or climate
full of intense emotion, especially passionate love or desire
examples: The torrid desert heat exhausted the travelers
They endured torrid summer temperatures
Their torrid romance scandalized the town
The novel described a torrid love affair

definitions: full of twists, turns, and bends; winding
excessively lengthy, complex, or convoluted
examples: The tortuous mountain road challenged even experienced drivers
They followed a tortuous path through the forest
His tortuous explanation confused everyone present
The tortuous legal process took years

definitions: showing signs of having suffered severe pain or anguish
produced through extreme effort; forced and unnatural
examples: His tortured screams echoed through the dungeon
The tortured expression on her face revealed everything
Her tortured logic failed to convince anyone
The tortured prose made the book unreadable

definitions: inflicting severe physical or mental pain and suffering
examples: The torturing pain kept him awake all night
Her torturing headaches required medical attention
The torturing memories haunted him for years
They endured torturing uncertainty about their future

definitions: complete in extent or degree; absolute or utter
comprising the whole number, amount, or quantity
examples: The project was a total disaster from start to finish
She felt total confidence in her decision
The total cost exceeded our budget significantly
Total attendance reached five thousand people

definitions: completely wrecked or damaged beyond economical repair
examples: The totaled car was towed to the junkyard
His totaled vehicle couldn't be salvaged
The storm left several totaled buildings downtown
Their totaled boat sank within minutes
